messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] well, helllll
messages.msgSnippet: ... My church tells me I m not going to hell, and my school-at-home colleagues are sure that I am.  I figure I win either way, since I ve met some pretty
messages.messageBody:
> Now I have no
> reason to fear hell.

My church tells me I'm not going to hell, and my school-at-home colleagues
are sure that I am. I figure I win either way, since I've met some pretty
facinating people here (and elsewhere) that will surely be there, too, if
the doomsayers are right. Should be a very nice party. (So long as there's
no dr. pepper...I agree, Mary!)

brenda

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] well, helllll
messages.msgSnippet: We just returned from a week long family reunion with my husband s family.  They are deeply religious Pentecost....they are SURE we are going to hell.  It s
messages.messageBody:
We just returned from a week long family reunion with my husband's family. They are deeply religious Pentecost....they are SURE we are going to hell. It's really sad to see the pity in their faces for us since we haven't "seen the light". They continually try each year to save us.................
(My husband is a recovering Mormon.....a very long story....)

BTW it was the longest week of my life!!! It's so good to be home.

Kimber


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
